text.0: allied with thee in this thy friendship soma indra for man made waters flow together.
text.1: slew ahi and sent forth the seven rivers and opened as it were obstructed fountains.
text.2: indu with thee for his confederate indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of sūrya.
text.3: what rolled all lifes support on heavens high summit was separated from the great oppressor.
text.4: indra smote down agni consumed o indu the dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict.
text.5: of those who gladly sought a hardwon dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.
text.6: lower than all besides hast thou o indra cast down the dasyus abject tribes of dāsas.
text.7: ye drave away ye put to death the foemen and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.
text.8: so of a truth indra and soma heroes ye burst the stable of the kine and horses.
text.9: the stable which the bar or stone obstructed and piercing through set free the habitations.
